verilog-02-combinational-logic.title: Verilog 02 – Combinational Logic
verilog-02-combinational-logic.description: Model combinational circuits using Verilog constructs

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content:
Combinational logic is a type of digital logic where the output depends only on the current inputs.
This module focuses on modeling combinational circuits using Verilog.

sections.title: 2. Logic Gates in Verilog
sections.content:
Common logic gates and their operators:
AND (&)
OR (|)
NOT (~)
XOR (^)

sections.title: 3. Continuous Assign Statements
sections.content: The assign keyword is used to model combinational logic.
sections.example:
assign sum = a ^ b;
assign carry = a & b;

sections.title: 4. always @(*) for Combinational Logic
